The pork is the most commonly consumed meat in the world, making up about 38% of meat production worldwide.
Pork is a common ingredient in many cuisines. It is particularly common in the Western world, where it is prepared in many ways, such as roasting, grilling, and frying, among many others.

Pork ribs are a cut of pork popular in Western and Asian cuisines. The ribcage of a domestic pig, meat and bones together, is cut into usable pieces, prepared by smoking, grilling, or baking – usually with a sauce, often barbecue – and then served.

A pig is any of the animals in the genus Sus, within the even-toed ungulate family Suidae. Pigs include the domestic pig and its ancestor, the common Eurasian wild boar, along with other species; related creatures outside the genus include the peccary, the babirusa, and the warthog.
